header.title: The Scroll of Set, December 1997
header.category: Western Esotericism, Left-Hand Path, Occultism, Setianism, Black Magic

central_thesis: This issue of 'The Scroll of Set' serves as a comprehensive guide and philosophical exposition for initiates of the Temple of Set, emphasizing the core principles of Left-Hand Path (LHP) self-deification (Xeper), active self-transformation, and the practical application of Black Magic. It provides tools and perspectives for individual awakening, conscious evolution, and strategic engagement with both internal (Subjective Universe) and external (Objective Universe) realities, contrasting these with traditional Right-Hand Path (RHP) submission.

structure_content.summary: Outlines an annual magical and mundane self-assessment process for Setians, including paying dues, rereading foundational texts, evaluating personal progress, burying the hatchet with former enemies, cursing real enemies, and planning future magical development.

Discusses the religious nature of Setian philosophy, the importance of international conclaves as unifying sacred events for a geographically diverse LHP organization, and the commitment required for true initiation and Xeper.

Clarifies the organizational structures within the Temple of Set: Pylons, Orders, and Elements. Defines their distinct functions in supporting individual initiation, fostering magical development, and applying Black Magic, while cautioning against routine that may deflect Xeper.

Explores the concept of the Subjective Universe (SU) as the mind's internal realm, connecting it to Egyptian 'ka' and the 'magical persona'. Argues that manipulating the SU is central to Great Black Magic (GBM) for self-transformation and achieving a dual perspective of reality.

Examines the 'Djam Scepter' (also called 'Breath-giver' or 'Giver of Winds') as a symbol of dominion and magical power in Setian ritual. It traces its origins to ancient Egyptian texts and connects its acquisition to the process of sundering the past and achieving self-created life.

Presents a philosophy of Black Magic where the magician shapes reality by making the universe believe a 'terribly outrageous lie' through conviction. It emphasizes the power of belief and the magician's role as the teller of the 'truth'.

Focuses on Lesser Black Magic (LBM) through the written word. It categorizes written LBM into informational, propaganda, and fiction, providing specific guidelines for each to achieve precise and convincing magical communication.

Introduces proxemics as a tool for LHP practitioners to understand and consciously manipulate their physical and psychological environments. It distinguishes between microproxemic (personal) and macroproxemic (impersonal/group) areas, emphasizing their role in initiating change and self-development.

key_concepts.definition: An ongoing evolution that heightens one's being; the process of becoming aware of oneself and acting upon that awareness. It is the central goal of Setian initiation, leading to godhood or mental institution based on one's judgment.

A spiritual and magical orientation based on self-sovereignty, individual experience, active creation, and the denial of external submission. It is contrasted with the Right-Hand Path's focus on submission and inherited dogma.

Lesser Black Magic (LBM) is concerned with influencing the external world for personal gain or practical outcomes. Greater Black Magic (GBM) is focused on internal self-transformation, the manipulation of the Subjective Universe, and astral projection.

The internal environment of the mind, a fluid realm connected to imagination, the Egyptian 'ka' (ancestral/protective essence), and the magical persona. It is the locus for GBM and can be manipulated by the magician's will.

The study and conscious manipulation of physical and psychological space. Microproxemics deals with personal relations and immediate surroundings, while macroproxemics influences larger social mechanisms and groups. It is a tool for LHP praxis to understand and alter environments.

The inner spark of divinity, the self-within-self, the part of the human that allows for self-realization. It is also described as the synthesizing force in the LHP alchemist's path to an empowered self.
The self-realization of the singularity of the self through self-isolation in the Subjective Universe, resulting in absolute awareness of self and not-self, leading to Xeper.
A magical weapon and symbol of dominion and magical power, gained through Setian ritual, representing the sundering of what is dead and past, and the emergence of self-created life.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined across these articles is one of active, conscious self-initiation and transformation rooted in Left-Hand Path philosophy. It involves an annual cycle of self-assessment and planning, the strategic application of both Lesser Black Magic (LBM) for external influence and Greater Black Magic (GBM) for internal self-transformation. Key to this system is the deliberate manipulation of one's subjective reality and external environments, fostering individual evolution (Xeper) through critical thinking, emotional awareness, and symbolic actions.
tools: Crystal Tablet: A foundational text for self-reflection and understanding Temple protocol.
InterCommunication Roster (ICR): A directory for Setians to contact each other for networking and sharing insights.
Pentagram of Set: Symbol of self-ordering and protection.
Djam Scepter (Tcham): A magical weapon symbolizing dominion and magical power, attained through specific rites.
Written Word: Utilized as a Lesser Black Magic tool for informational dissemination, propaganda, and crafting narratives (fiction) that shape belief and reality.
Proxemic Understanding: Knowledge and conscious manipulation of micro- and macroproxemic spaces to influence self and others.
Dream Journaling: Recording and analyzing dreams to uncover patterns, find one's true will, and plan for future actions.
Black Flame: The internal source of empowerment and individual divinity, cultivated through LHP praxis.
rituals: Annual self-assessment and magical bookkeeping (e.g., paying dues, rereading texts, evaluating progress).
Personal purification and release of negative energies (e.g., culling false friends, 'burying the hatchet', cursing real enemies).

A Working for Illustrative Dreams: Involves a specific invocation to Set as 'author of nightmares', visualization of descending seven hundred steps into the Dream realm, and focused intent to induce illustrative dreams.

The 'Festival of the Slaying of Osiris': A symbolic rite to shatter a block of green faience, leading to the acquisition of the Djam Scepter, representing the sundering of the past and gaining magical power.

Manipulation of the Subjective Universe: Achieved through concentration and visualization to create a personal reality and/or an astral double ('Doppelgänger') for GBM, allowing the ego to 'leave the world of the OU and enter the world of magic'.
Ritual use of communication: Applying principles of LBM through the written word (informational, propaganda, fiction) to subtly and convincingly convey messages and influence reality.
Conclave participation: Attending international conclaves as a 'sacrament' for collective and individual initiation, fostering unity and 'magical exchanges'.
Defining and manifesting a 'magical persona': The idealized self assumed for working GBM effectively, enabling work without the limitations of the Objective Universe.

relevant_quotes.text: The Temple is of course slandered by author Thomas. These fictional Setians are dedicated to their self-knowledge, directly seeking immortality through the psychecentric methods available to them.

The magician who succeeds in controlling or altering another individual's "personal fields" thus controls or alters that person just as assuredly as though he were able to control his conscious personality.

Xeper, or becoming aware of yourself and acting [upon this awareness], the Initiate takes a journey which can lead to godhood or a mental institution, depending upon his judgment and appreciation of the Balance Factor.
Magic's just when you trick the universe into believing some terribly outrageous lie. - John Constantine, Hellblazer

The LHP alchemist takes the positive force of pride (of recognizing one's real accomplishments), the negative force of humility (of recognizing one's limits), and the synthesizing force of the Black Flame to produce a Fourth Force - his empowered self.

Now let the Setian shun all recitation, for the text of another is an affront to the self. Speak rather to me as a friend, gently and without fear, and I shall hear as a friend. Do not bend your knee nor drop your eye, for such things were not done in my house at Pa Mat-et.

If comprehension is based upon knowledge of two discrete systems as in resonance then higher-ordered (more energetic) relationships with those systems will result in "seeing more" within the same perceptual and cognitive frameworks we, as humans, all share.

critical_analysis.relevance: This issue of 'The Scroll of Set' is highly relevant for practitioners of Western Esotericism and Occultism, particularly within the Temple of Set's LHP framework. It provides both theoretical depth (e.g., Subjective Universe, Proxemics, LHP Gnosticism) and practical applications (e.g., Year's End self-assessment, dream working, magical scribing). The articles contextualize Setian philosophy within broader occult traditions and offer actionable strategies for individual initiation and magical development. The emphasis on self-sovereignty, critical thinking, and continuous evolution aligns with advanced occult practices.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is Initiates of the Temple of Set, ranging from new I° Initiates seeking foundational understanding and practical guidance to higher-degree Setians exploring advanced concepts and contributing to the Temple's evolution. It also appeals to external academics and practitioners of Left-Hand Path magic interested in the specific philosophy, methodologies, and organizational aspects of the Temple of Set.
